Madagasgar is passionate about medical research and is currently working on a program that can monitor and predict the spread of diseases over a geographical region. They are currently debating between two methods to track the number of infections over time in each region. Method A uses a for loop to step through each day and update the counts, while Method B uses a while loop that stops once there haven't been any changes in the counts for three consecutive days. Which method should Madagasgar choose to use?

QuestionJSON.Answer1: Method A, because it is easier to read and understand.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Method B, because it will use less computation time in situations where the infection numbers stabilize quickly.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Method A, because it will ensure that all data is taken into account, irrespective of the rate of change in infection numbers.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Method B, because it allows for more real-time analysis and can stop tracking once the numbers stabilize, hence saving computational resources.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: For this application, real-time analysis is critical as it can aid in quicker decision making. Method B seems more feasible as it not only takes care of the computational efficiency but also focuses on the real time tracking and control of disease spread.
